author: robocopsgonemad
content: i think i found a spec ambiguity with regarding to tx signature field naming on eth_getBlockByNumber and friends... specs claim it should form txs in the block per the return val of eth_getTransactionByHash, which describes the signature as r,s,v. EIP-4844 describes the signature values as r,s,yParity.  Besu has been updated recently to use v in legacy transactions, but yParity in BlobTransactions, so we are now failing many hive tests.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: i think i'm going to update Besu to always return v over rpc calls for any txs, regardless of type.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: will read up on the naming change before suggesting a pr to edit 4844.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: ok, after looking into it i think the hive tests need to be updated. new blob transactions are the first to not allow V in favor of yParity. so the assertions in blob tests looking for that field need to be renamed.
